poem:
**Flight Path**  

In the skies over Europe,  
a flight path turns ghostly,  
its signal swallowed by silence,  
like a secret whispered to the night.  
The night air carries tension  
as if stars were blinking Morse code,  
while below, cities spin unknowing,  
the world still turning  
under unseen wings.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Italy considers hiding state flight paths after jamming of von der Leyen plane Italy is considering keeping state flights secret after the satellite signal of the aircraft carrying the European Commission president, Ursula von der Leyen, was allegedly jammed by Russia, Italian defence ministry sources said. Von der Leyen, a fierce critic of the Russian president, Vladimir Putin, and Moscow’s war in Ukraine, was flying to Bulgaria on Sunday when her charter plane lost satellite". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
